title: How to get Maroon 5 tickets: Las Vegas, Chicago, Boston, and more
description: Maroon 5 is hitting major cities across the US, and tickets are available from verified resellers like StubHub and Vivid Seats.
content: Maroon 5 fans are overjoyed as the band has announced their 2025 fall tour, Love Is Like. The tour is in support of their newest album of the same name, which was released on August 15. The tour is set to kick off with a music festival in Las Vegas on September 19, with the band visiting major cities across the United States. The tour is scheduled to come to a close with the final performance taking the band all the way to Dubai on December 31.The band has seen significant success since its debut in 1994. With radio hits like “She Will Be Loved” and “Makes Me Wonder” under their belt, Maroon 5 has become a household name for pop fans around the world, earning many awards over the years. In January 2023, it was announced that "Moves like Jagger" was the second most downloaded song of all time. Over the years, Maroon 5 has sold more than 135 million records.We've got you covered if you're looking for how to get tickets to Maroon 5's Love Is Like tour. Here's our breakdown of Maroon 5's show schedule, purchasing details, and original and resale ticket price comparisons. You can also browse ticket specifics at your leisure on StubHub and Vivid Seats.Maroon 5’s Love Is Like tour will see the band play 24 shows in major cities across the United States and one final show in Dubai. The tour starts in Las Vegas on September 19 and is scheduled to end on December 31.*Date is for a music festival where Maroon 4 will be appearing alongside other artists.You can buy standard original tickets for Maroon 5’s Love Is Like tour dates on Ticketmaster. Tickets to Maroon 5’s 2025 concert tour can also be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors like StubHub and Vivid Seats. With several shows already sold out of original tickets, you may find better luck with seating variety and availability on these sites.Ticket prices for Maroon 5’s Love Is Like tour dates vary depending on the date, location, and demand for each show. Remaining original tickets on Ticketmaster range between $61 to $107, however several concerts have already sold out.The least expensive tickets on StubHub range from $73 for the October 25 show in Salt Lake City to $4,964 for the performance in Dubai on December 31. On average, tickets range from $80 to $90.Vivid Seats has similar pricing, with the cheapest tickets ranging from $63 for the November 25 Michigan concert to $378 for the music festival in Las Vegas on September 19. The average price of tickets ranges from $75 to $90.Claire Rosinkranz will open for Maroon 5 on the Love Is Like tour. She is an American singer and songwriter from California who had her breakthrough in 2020 with her single "Backyard Boy."Maroon 5 has exactly one international performance scheduled for December 31 in Dubai. As of writing, no additional international stops have been added to the tour.Maroon 5 consists of six members: lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist Adam Levine, rhythm guitarist and keyboardist Jesse Carmichael, lead guitarist James Valentine, drummer Matt Flynn, keyboardist PJ Morton, and bassist Sam Farrar.
summary: Maroon 5 has announced its 2025 fall tour, Love Is Like, in support of their latest album. The tour will begin in Las Vegas on September 19 and will see 24 shows across the United States before ending in Dubai on December 31. Tickets can be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors like StubHub and Vivid Seats. The band has been a major hit since their debut in 1994 and has sold over 135 million records. No additional international stops have been added to the tour.
shortSummary: Maroon 5's 2025 "Love Is Like" tour, featuring 24 shows in major cities and a final performance in Dubai, is set to begin in September 19.

One of the most powerful mainstream bands active today, Maroon 5 has remained at the apex of pop music with an undeniably addictive blend of rock, soul, and R&B. Maroon 5 stormed into the public eye in 2002 with the release of its multi-Platinum studio debut, “Songs About Jane,” which launched the band’s career with four back-to-back top 40 singles, including “This Love” and “She Will Be Loved.” In later years, chart-topping hits like “Moves Like Jagger” and “One More Night” have kept the Los Angeles-based rock outfit in high demand. They even performed at the Super Bowl Halftime show in 2019. Most recently, the band released new albums, Red Pill Blues, JORDI, and Overexposed, featuring collaborations with SZA and LunchMoney Lewis. The three-time Grammy Award-winning band will tour in 2025 behind their new album Love is Like. Purchase your own set of Maroon 5 tickets from Vivid Seats, and see this Adam Levine-fronted outfit and all its electrifying energy on stage. Being there is all that matters!
No matter what you're looking to spend, Vivid Seats has tickets to fit your budget. Currently, Maroon 5 tickets at Vivid Seats start at €72.
No matter what you're looking to spend, Vivid Seats has you covered, with options for cheap Maroon 5 tickets. Right now, the cheapest price for Maroon 5 tickets is €72.
Maroon 5 will be taking the stage on Oct. 6 at PHX Arena in Phoenix to kick off their 2025 tour. They will then head to Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York City, among other tour stops.
Yes, Maroon 5 will tour in 2025! The Love is Like Tour begins on Oct. 6 at PHX Arena in Phoenix and concludes on Nov. 25 at Little Caesars Arena in Detroit.
Maroon 5 floor seats can provide a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Often, floor seats can be some of the most expensive tickets at a show. Sometimes Vivid Seats offers VIP Maroon 5 meet and greet tickets, which can cost more than front row seats or floor tickets. Currently, the maximum price for Maroon 5 tickets is €9,497, a price that could apply to the best Maroon 5 tickets available.

If you've been seeing all of the Backstreet Boys hype on social media, it's not too late to witness the legendary boy band at the Las Vegas Sphere. Their 21-show residency kicked off on July 11 and continues through the summer, but seats have been flying fast, leaving mostly verified resellers to secure your place. I've broken down how to buy Backstreet Boys tickets below to help you out.
The Backstreet Boys made their debut in 1993 and remain one of the most popular boy bands of all time. Their new Las Vegas residency, which will be built around the futuristic themes and songs of their "Millennium" album, is an ode to the album's original 130-show tour in 1999, also similarly titled "Into the Millennium."
The Venetian Resort's Sphere is a famous venue reserved for legendary musicians. It currently hosts Kenny Chesney and has the Backstreet Boys scheduled for later this summer. The venue has also recently hosted the Eagles and Dead and Company. The location's unique architecture lends to a completely immersive, once-in-a-lifetime experience that can't be missed for fans of the performing artist.
General ticket sales are in full swing, and seats are selling out fast. But if you're still hoping to secure your tickets to the 2025 Backstreet Boys residency, we're here to help. Ahead, find our breakdown of the 2025 residency schedule, purchasing details, comparisons between prices for original and resale tickets, and the potential setlist. You can also look at ticket details at your leisure on StubHub and Vivid Seats.
- See also: Is StubHub legit? | Lady Gaga tickets | Coldplay tickets | Dua Lipa tickets | Usher tickets | Eagles tickets | Oasis tickets | Metallica tickets
Backstreet Boys' 2025 residency schedule
The Backstreet Boys kick off their Las Vegas residency on July 11, with shows currently planned through late August at the Sphere at the Venetian Resort. The tour has already been extended twice since its announcement, adding additional dates in August. Since no following performers have been scheduled for the Sphere afterward, there is also a chance that the Backstreet Boys residency can gain even more shows in the future.

How to buy tickets for Backstreet Boys' 2025 concert residency
Tickets can also be purchased from verified resale ticket vendors such as StubHub and Vivid Seats. As the tickets for the Backstreet Boys' residency are in high demand, you may find more variety in seating options and availability from these sites, and cheaper prices compared to the original tickets on Ticketmaster..
How much are Backstreet Boys tickets?
Tickets to the Backstreet Boys' 2025 residency vary slightly depending on availability.
At present, the least expensive option on StubHub is $146 for their show on August 22 and ranges up to $269 for their July 12 performance. Resale tickets from StubHub on average fall into the range of $150 to $400.
Vivid Seats offers similar pricing when it comes to the most inexpensive tickets, with a range of $130 for their August 22 show up to $238 for their July 12 performance. Similar to StubHub, most tickets on Vivid Seats average $170 to $350 before taxes and fees.
Who is opening for Backstreet Boys' residency?
Currently, it has not been announced if the Backstreet Boys will have an opening act for their Las Vegas residency. It's uncommon for Las Vegas residencies to have opening acts, so it is unlikely there will be one for Backstreet Boys: Into the Millennium.
Will there be international performance dates?
As of writing, the Backstreet Boys: Into The Millennium 2025 shows are limited to their Las Vegas residency, with no other locations or international stops planned. However, after the residency wraps up on August 24, the Backstreet Boys are scheduled to perform alongside several other acts at the The Town music festival in São Paulo on September 12. Tickets are available on StubHub starting at $94.

Dua Lipa's highly anticipated Radical Optimism Tour is well underway, which will take the pop star across the globe through the end of 2025. While tickets are selling fast, there are a few strategies for buying Dua Lipa tickets for her coming concerts.
Radical Optimism marks the "Levitating" singer's third headlining tour, which celebrates the star's 2024 album of the same name. With dozens of shows already on the schedule, The Radical Optimism Tour kicked off on November 5, 2024, in Singapore. During the tour's remaining stops in 2025, Dua Lipa is scheduled to perform in the UK and Ireland, North America, and South America. After a little over a year on the road, Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour is set to conclude on December 5, 2025, in Mexico City.
While new dates were recently added in Argentina, Chile, Brazil, Peru, Colombia, and Mexico, Dua Lipa has not rescheduled her canceled show in Jakarta, Indonesia, which was originally scheduled for November 9, 2024. So far, the “Houdini” singer has not announced whether the concert will be rescheduled, though she reportedly cited safety concerns for the cancellation.
We’ve got you covered if you’re looking for how to get tickets to Dua Lipa’s 2025 concerts. Here’s our breakdown of Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour 2025 schedule, purchasing details, comparisons between prices for original and resale tickets, and the potential setlist. You can also browse ticket and concert specifics at your convenience on Vivid Seats and StubHub.

How to buy tickets for Dua Lipa’s 2025 concert tour
You can buy tickets to Dua Lipa’s 2025 concert tour on Ticketmaster. While standard original tickets are still available for most remaining dates, the inventory is low due to the high demand to see the singer perform live.
Tickets to see Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour are also sold through verified resale ticket vendors such as Vivid Seats and StubHub. For tour dates where the number of original tickets remaining is limited, you may find better luck with seating availability and variety on these resale sites.
How much are Dua Lipa tickets?
Compared to similar pop stars currently on tour, tickets to see Dua Lipa in 2025 are generally reasonably priced. Of course, the Radical Optimism Tour ticket prices vary depending on the show's date, location, and demand.
On StubHub, the lowest available prices for tickets to Dua Lipa’s 2025 concert tour range from $36 for her show in Lima, Peru, on November 25 to $474 for her New York City performance on September 20. Overall, this platform's cheapest resale ticket prices typically fall between the $80 and $250 range.
Vivid Seats offers similar resale ticket prices for Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour. The lowest prices for Dua Lipa tickets on this site begin from $55 for the June 24 show in Liverpool to $308 for the New York City show on September 21. Generally, Vivid Seats’ cheapest resale ticket prices for the 2025 tour fall between $70-200, depending on the show. Currently, these resale ticket prices typically offer a better value than comparable standard original tickets still available.
Who is opening for Dua Lipa’s tour?

Dua Lipa's previous Future Nostalgia Tour in 2022 featured a variety of openers, including Megan Thee Stallion, Tove Lo, and Griff.
Will there be international tour dates?
Multiple international legs are scheduled for Dua Lipa’s Radical Optimism Tour. Her 11-show tour leg in Asia ended in early December. There are five remaining shows scheduled in the UK and Ireland before Dua Lipa returns to North America in the fall. Then the singer will continue onto South America for 11 more shows before wrapping up the tour in Mexico City.
The full schedule for Dua Lipa’s international tour dates can be found in the tour breakdown above. Kesha's joyride across the US isn't done just yet, and she has five more dates left for fans to see her live. Seats are especially affordable compared to other pop stars, so it's especially easy to reserve seats for one of her remaining concerts. With that in mind, I've broken down all you need to know to get Kesha tickets.
The Tits Out Tour features Kesha co-headlining alongside the Scissor Sisters. It started on July 1 in West Valley City, Utah, only one month after Kesha’s previous tour ended. It’s scheduled to include 26 shows altogether before concluding with the singer’s appearance at All Things Go Music Festival in Columbia, Maryland, in late September. The new tour promotes Kesha’s sixth studio album, “Period,” which went live July 4 this year. It was the first to be released independently through her label, Kesha Records.
If you’re hoping to hear new hits like “Joyride,” “Yippee-Ki-Yay,” and potentially Kesha classics like “Your Love Is My Drug” and “We R Who We R,” now is a great time to pick up tickets to see her live. Keep scrolling to learn more about Kesha’s 2025 tour schedule, including prices, dates, and more.

How to buy tickets for Kesha’s 2025 concert tour
You can buy standard tickets for Kesha’s Tits Out Tour on Ticketmaster. The presale for original tickets began on April 8, with general sale starting on April 10, and some venues are already sold out. Original tickets for the remainder of Kesha’s House of Kesha tour are no longer available on Ticketmaster.
Tickets for the Tits Out Tour can also be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors like StubHub and Vivid Seats. For tour dates with a more limited inventory of original tickets, you may find better luck with seating variety and availability on these sites. Verified resale ticket vendors still have some tickets for the remaining House of Kesha concerts.
There are VIP tickets for the Tits Out Tour available through Ticketmaster; The Joyride Guided Tour Experience, Animals Lounge Experience, and the Yippee-Ki-Yay VIP Package. Details about what each VIP includes can be found on the tour website. It should be noted that packages do not include a meet and greet with Kesha.
How much are Kesha tickets?
Ticket prices for the 2025 Tits Out Tour dates vary depending on the date, location, and demand for each show. Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, aka Bad Bunny, is a Puerto Rican rapper, singer, and songwriter. How to buy tickets for Bad Bunny's 2025 and 2026 concert tour
Original tickets for Bad Bunny’s residency sold out in only four hours after release. Original tickets for the Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour are available on the Colombian Ticket Master website, if they haven’t sold out already.
Fortunately, Bad Bunny Tickets are available through verified resale websites like StubHub and Vivid Seats. It should be noted, however, that Vivid Seats does not carry tickets for all countries that Bad Bunny will be performing in.
How much are Bad Bunny tickets?
Prices for standard tickets to Bad Bunny's residency and Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour vary significantly depending on date, location, and availability. Overall, prices for the Puerto Rico residency are significantly higher than prices for the rapper’s world stadium tour.
On StubHub, the lowest resale prices range from $53 for the March 1, 2026, show in Sydney to $752 for the concert in San Juan on September 13, 2025. Overall, the least expensive StubHub tickets tend to fall between $600 and $700 for the residency this fall and $100 to $200 for the 2025-2026 world tour.
Vivid Seats offers similar price ranges for Bad Bunny's performances, starting between $113 on June 3, 2026, in Madrid and $732 for the show in San Juan on September 14, 2025. Overall, the least expensive Vivid Seats tickets tend to fall in the same ranges as StubHub.
Who is opening for Bad Bunny's tour?

Will there be international tour dates?
All of Bad Bunny's coming performances for both the ongoing residency and his Debí Tirar Más Fotos World Tour will be international, with the rapper appearing in major cities across Central America, South America, Australia, and Europe. No North American dates have been announced, so many fans hoping to see Bad Bunny live in 2025 or 2026 may have to travel to do so.

It's not too late to make your own unforgettable memories at a Coldplay concert. The band's hit Music of the Spheres tour continues through early September, and seats are still available. I've broken down how to buy Coldplay tickets before their next date below.
Following the release of their October 2024 album “Moon Music,” Chris Martin and Coldplay announced that they would stay on the road throughout 2025 to travel across various cities in the United States and Canada. The upcoming shows are part of their ongoing Music of the Spheres Tour, which began in 2022 following the debut of their eponymous 2021 album. The latest extension brings the tour’s total show count to over 200 concerts, during which the band has already accrued more than $1 billion in box office sales.
The 2025 North American leg of Coldplay’s Music of the Spheres Tour includes an additional 17 shows across various cities. These concert dates join Coldplay’s 2025 performances in Asia before the band returns to London. After three years on the road, Coldplay is currently scheduled to bring their Music of the Spheres Tour to a close on September 8, 2025, after a 10-show stint at Wembley Stadium in London.
We’ve got you covered if you’re looking for how to get tickets to Coldplay’s 2025 Music of the Spheres Tour. Here’s our breakdown of Coldplay’s 2025 concert schedule, purchasing details, and price comparisons between original and resale tickets. You can also browse ticket and concert specifics on StubHub and Vivid Seats at your leisure.
- See also: Is StubHub legit? | Eagles tickets | Oasis tickets | Sabrina Carpenter tickets | Dua Lipa tickets | Bruno Mars tickets | Backstreet Boys tickets | Beyoncé tickets
Coldplay 2025 tour schedule
Coldplay’s 2025 tour started on January 9 in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. The leg across Asia included 16 concerts across four cities, concluding on April 25 in Seoul, South Korea. Coldplay is now in North America, playing 17 concerts across the United States and Canada until their Miami show on July 27. The band then returns to England for 12 shows in Kingston upon Hull and London, taking their final bow of the Music of the Spheres Tour on September 8, 2025.

How to buy tickets for Coldplay 2025 concert tour
You can buy standard original tickets to Coldplay’s 2025 tour on Ticketmaster. However, the quantity of remaining standard original tickets is limited due to high demand, with all of the United States, Canada, and England concert dates already being sold out.
Tickets for Coldplay’s 2025 Music of the Spheres Tour can also be purchased through verified resale ticket vendors such as StubHub and Vivid Seats. Given the limited or sold-out inventory of standard original tickets, you may have better luck with availability and seating variety on these resale sites.
It’s also important to note that Vivid Seats does not have tickets being sold for Coldplay’s 2025 Abu Dhabi, Mumbai, Hong Kong, and Seoul shows.
How much are Coldplay tickets?
Ticket prices for Coldplay’s 2025 Music of the Spheres tour vary depending on the date, location, and demand for each show. Currently, original tickets on Ticketmaster are already sold out, which means the available ticket prices are based on resale passes.
On StubHub, the least expensive resale tickets for Coldplay’s 2025 concerts range from $132 for their Seoul, South Korea, date on April 16, to $507 for the band’s Kingston upon Hull, England, show on August 18. Vivid Seats offers similar resale ticket prices for the Music of the Spheres Tour, with the cheapest available ticket costs starting from $160 for their April 16 Seoul show to $572 for Coldplay’s August 30 concert in London. However, the lowest ticket prices generally fall between the $250 to $250 range.
Who is opening for Coldplay’s tour?
So far, only some concert dates for Coldplay’s 2025 shows have a confirmed opening act. Elyanna supported the band on their Abu Dhabi, UAE, shows on January 9, 11, 12, and 14. The nine-member hit K-pop group Twice collaborated with them for the Seoul leg of the tour in April this year.
The opening acts for Coldplay’s other 2025 tour dates in Asia, North America, and Europe will be announced later.
Will there be international tour dates?
In addition to the band’s scheduled dates in North America, Coldplay has 28 international tour dates set in 2025. This includes seven shows across Abu Dhabi and Mumbai that have already passed, three in Hong Kong, six in Seoul, two in Kingston upon Hull, and ten in London.
The full schedule for Coldplay’s 2025 international tour dates can be found in the concert breakdown above. You can also find resale tickets for their shows in Asia on StubHub, and the concert dates in England are available on UK StubHub.

StubHub is one of the most popular ticket resale sites for online shoppers, making it a household name alongside Ticketmaster and Live Nation. In the age where scams lurk behind every corner, it's scary to trust any site with something like your money or a once-in-a-lifetime event. With that in mind, I dove deeper into StubHub's guarantees and conditions to explain why so many eventgoers, like myself, trust the platform.
For those who haven't used or heard of it before, StubHub is a website marketplace that allows fans of sporting events, musicians, comedians, and other live acts to buy and sell tickets to each other in a regulated space. It services more than just the US, too, offering seats to coveted performances in countries around the world.
Keep reading to learn more about StubHub's protections for both buyers and sellers.
Is StubHub legit?
In short, StubHub is a trustworthy place to buy and sell tickets for major events. Although the company itself is not the seller, it still offers safeguards for both parties in a sale to prevent any potential scams from occurring. It does mean, however, that StubHub does not control the pricing for event tickets — these are set by the users selling them. The site will instead recommend price points for sellers during the listing process.
StubHub gives a 100% guarantee to every order under its exclusive FanProtect Guarantee, which I've broken down below.
How StubHub protects ticket buyers
Ticket buying from a reseller is sometimes the only option for sold-out and high-demand shows. StubHub is a great place to find tickets, especially with its FanProtect Guarantee to cover orders. Here's what it promises for buyers:
- Tickets will be delivered in time for the event.
- The ticket will be valid for the event.
- Issues will be resolved with comparable or better tickets or a refund.
- Event cancellations that aren't rescheduled can be reimbursed with a 120% StubHub credit or a full refund.
For even more information, you can check out StubHub's buyer terms and conditions.
How StubHub protects ticket sellers
Whether you've changed your mind or need to cancel a scheduled event, StubHub is a simple platform for ticket sellers. Listing is quick and easy, and pricing research isn't necessary with the site's recommendations. It also protects its sellers just as well as its buyers under the same FanProtect Guarantee.
StubHub's main promise is on-time payment for tickets sold. The full seller terms and conditions explain this more thoroughly.
What about StubHub fees?
Of course, such protections don't come without a price. StubHub, like every other third-party, charges fees for both fans and sellers. For the latter, you don't pay anything until your tickets sell. Percentages aren't set in stone; they can differ based on ticket prices, event dates, supply, and demand.
Only two costs are added to purchases: a service fee and a fulfillment fee. These can be viewed before, during, and after checkout — here's how:
- Before checkout: Click on the event page filters and change "Price Display Options" to "Include estimated fees."
- During checkout: The entire cost is broken down on the "Review and buy" page, underneath "Your order summary."
- After checkout: Check your order receipt to see the fee breakdown at the bottom.
Head on over to StubHub to browse the latest ticket prices for concerts, live sports, comedy shows, and more.

Los Angeles pop-rock band Maroon 5 burst onto the scene in 2002 with debut album Songs About Jane, which featured a successful string of singles that included “This Love,” “Sunday Morning,” and “She Will Be Loved.” Fronted by lead vocalist and rhythm guitarist Adam Levine, Maroon 5 is rounded out by rhythm guitarist and keyboardist Jesse Carmichael, lead guitarist James Valentine, drummer Matt Flynn, keyboardist PJ Morton, and bassist and sampler Sam Farrar.
Maroon 5 have released seven studio albums to date, tracking through blends of rock, funk, R&B, and pop with chart-topping singles like “Moves Like Jagger” and “Sugar.” Having cultivated a reputation for bright production and energetic hooks, the band have headlined multiple world tours and performed at major global events, including the Super Bowl LIII Halftime Show in 2019. Known for a staunch commitment to the environment, Maroon 5 have partnered with non-profit organization Reverb since 2008 to reduce their carbon footprint on tour, and the bandmates are members of the NRDC (Natural Resources Defense Council).
Over the course of their career, Maroon 5 have earned three Grammy Awards and sold over 120 million records. The band is hitting the road in October of 2025 for the LOVE IS LIKE Tour.

Maroon 5 will hit the road in fall 2025 for the LOVE IS LIKE Tour, which kicks off October 6 in Phoenix and runs through late November. The band will make stops in major cities including San Francisco, Seattle, Chicago, New York and Boston. The tour wraps November 25 in Detroit.
Maroon 5’s 2025 LOVE IS LIKE Tour begins with a show at PHX Arena in Phoenix, Arizona on October 6.
Tickets for Maroon 5’s upcoming tour go on sale to the general public on Friday, June 27 at 10:00 a.m. local time via Ticketmaster. A series of presales will take place in the lead-up to the general ticket sale, beginning with on Wednesday, June 25 at 10:00 a.m. local time with the Maroon 5 S.I.N. Presale, which ends on Thursday, June 26 at 10:00 p.m. local time. Then, at 12:00 p.m. on Wednesday, June 25, the M5 Mailing List Presale will open.
Live Nation and Ticketmaster presales follow on Thursday, June 26 at 10:00 a.m. local time. All presales end Thursday at 10:00 p.m. local time on June 26.

argos_summary: Maroon 5 has announced their 2025 fall tour, titled 'Love Is Like,' in support of their new album released on August 15. The tour will kick off on September 19 with a music festival in Las Vegas and will include 24 shows across major U.S. cities, concluding with a performance in Dubai on December 31. Tickets are available through platforms like Ticketmaster, StubHub, and Vivid Seats, with prices varying based on location and demand.
